snippet: InBev, the world’s biggest brewer, and a smaller rival, Carlsberg, reported weakening sales in Russia.
lead_paragraph: InBev, the world’s biggest brewer, and a smaller rival, Carlsberg, reported weakening sales in Russia as cold weather and turmoil in financial markets affect demand for beer in one of their fastest-growing markets. Carlsberg, the Nordic region’s largest brewery, fell 6.2 percent in Copenhagen trading, while InBev dropped 4 percent in Brussels. Third-quarter volume sales in Russia declined “slightly” because of cool weather, according to Carlsberg, the country’s market leader. InBev said that Russian demand was slowing as drinkers shunned lower-priced brews. Carlsberg said the Russian beer market shrank “slightly” in the third quarter, mostly because of “exceptionally poor weather.”
